title: Why is recycling so important? The dirty truth behind our trash - ZME Science
summary: Recycling is the act of separating, collecting, and remanufacturing or converting used or waste products into new materials. Recycling has a lot of benefits, such as reducing the amount of waste that goes to landfills, conserving natural resources, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and creating jobs. Everyone can help close the recycling loop by buying new products made from recycled materials.
green_innovation: TRUE. Recycling is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing the amount of waste sent to landfills and conserving natural resources.
business_innovation: TRUE. Recycling is a business innovation because it is a new and improved process for waste management that has been adopted by many businesses.
green_product: TRUE. Recycled products are green products because they are made from materials that have been used before, which reduces the need to extract new raw materials from the Earth.
green_process: TRUE. Recycling is a green process because it reduces the amount of waste that goes to landfills, conserves natural resources, and reduces greenhouse gas emissions.
likely_naics_codes: ['562112 Solid Waste Collection', '562211 Hazardous Waste Collection', '562920 Materials Recovery Facilities', '562991 Refuse Systems']
greenwashing: FALSE. Recycling is not an example of greenwashing because it is a legitimate environmental practice that has been proven to have positive benefits for the environment.

title: FEATURE: "Horizontal recycling" tackling waste and giving plastics 2nd life - Kyodo News Plus
summary: Kobe, Japan has launched the "Kobe Plastic Next" initiative to promote horizontal recycling, a process where used  products are recycled into raw materials to reproduce the original item. The initiative aims to reduce plastic waste by recycling used plastic bottles and other items into the same thing, without the need for new petroleum-derived materials.  A number of companies are participating in the project, including Kao Corp., Lion Corp., and Earth Corp.  Some of these companies are developing technology to crush collected refill packs into pellets, which are then converted into film and remade into refill packs.
likely_naics_codes: ['326199 - All Other Plastics Products Manufacturing', '562211 - Solid Waste Collection', '562212 - Hazardous Waste Collection', '562219 - Other Nonhazardous Waste Collection']
greenwashing: The article does not provide evidence to suggest that the described product or process innovation is an example of greenwashing.

title: Johnson Controls launches a partnership with Nucor to recycle nearly 100% of scrap steel at major Johnson Controls ... - PR Newswire
summary: Johnson Controls has launched a closed-loop steel recycling partnership program with Nucor in the US. The program will salvage nearly 100% of secondary scrap steel at major Johnson Controls facilities in the US, amounting to thousands of tons per year, repurposing it as low-embodied-carbon steel. Johnson Controls sources over 70% of steel in the US and 45% globally from recycled materials, as part of its program to reduce embodied carbon across its product portfolio.

title: GUNPLA (GUNDAM Plastic Models) Recycling Project / METI Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry - meti.go.jp
summary: The GUNPLA Recycling Project launched by four Bandai Namco Group companies involves the collection of “runners,” the disposable frames that hold the plastic model parts in the original package, turning the runners into new plastic models through cutting-edge chemical recycling technology.  The collected runners are used for demonstration experiments of the latest chemical recycling technology, for material recycling and recycled into resin for "ECOPLA," (Eco Plastic Models) and are reborn as new GUNPLA, and for thermal recycling for sustainable power generation. Bandai Namco Group has installed dedicated collection boxes at its approximately 200 namco stores nationwide as well as other stores belonging to the Group.
green_innovation: TRUE, The GUNPLA Recycling Project involves the collection of runners, the disposable frames that hold the plastic model parts in the original package, turning the runners into new plastic models through cutting-edge chemical recycling technology.
business_innovation: TRUE, The GUNPLA Recycling Project involves the collection of runners, the disposable frames that hold the plastic model parts in the original package, turning the runners into new plastic models through cutting-edge chemical recycling technology.
green_product: TRUE, The new GUNPLA models, 'ECOPLA,' created through recycling are green products because they are made from recycled materials and are designed to be recycled again.
green_process: TRUE, The GUNPLA Recycling Project involves the collection of runners, the disposable frames that hold the plastic model parts in the original package, turning the runners into new plastic models through cutting-edge chemical recycling technology.

title: How yachts are disposed of – and why it's so environmentally toxic - Yachting Monthly
summary: The marine industry is facing a growing problem of how to dispose of redundant, environmentally toxic GRP-built craft. The annual volume of composite waste generated by the marine industry each year is a staggering 55,000 tonnes – and it’s predicted to increase by 10% every year in the near future as more and more leisure yachts reach their end of life (EOL). The marine industry is now reaching the point where a high volume of vessels are beginning to reach the end of their life, combining with a fast-evolving and much stricter waste control landscape than seen in previous decades.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes several green innovations that could help the marine industry to reduce its environmental impact, such as mechanical grinding, incineration with energy recovery, co-processing in cement production, pyrolysis, and solvolysis
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes several business innovations that could help the marine industry to become more sustainable, such as the APER scheme in France, which requires manufacturers to pay an ‘eco-contribution’ for every new boat sold.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions several green products, such as flax-based laminate panels and bio-based resin systems.
green_process: TRUE. The article mentions several green processes, such as design for disassembly and using thermally expanding graphite particles to create reversible bonding joints.

title: Global Black Mass Recycling Market Report 2023: A $52.99 Million Market by 2029 from $9.22 Million in 2022 - A ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global black mass recycling market is projected to reach $52,990.87 million by 2031 from $9,220.51 million in 2022, growing at a CAGR of 21.45% during the forecast period 2022-2031. The market for black mass recycling is anticipated to expand rapidly as electric vehicles gain popularity, which will also fuel the expansion of the black mass market for recycling. A few key players dominate the black mass recycling market, including Umicore, BASF SE, Tenova S.p.A., and many more. Nonetheless, a large number of new competitors are anticipated to enter the market in the upcoming years, increasing competition and spurring additional growth and innovation.
green_innovation: TRUE. Recycling of black mass is an environmental innovation that contributes to the goal of decarbonization by reducing the need for mining and refining of raw materials.
